pros: It’s a university that is an open space for growth and development as a person.

review_title: Interesting experience, not much room for professional growth
pros: There's a great work-life balance, it's not terribly stressful and the campus is a easy commute from the city or northern suburbs. Having Christmas break off and the summer family days were great. The work, especially with international students was very fulfilling.
cons:
There's very little room for professional growth and the office space is very old, windowless and depressing. Spending all day in a basement without windows wears on employees pretty quickly. 

The school was very inflexible about ever working from home, even in really bad weather, which was frustrating and dangerous. I heard leave packages for parents were generous, but overall vacation days were low beyond Christmas break. Pay was also on the very low end of recommended ranges; even other small schools in the area pay significantly better. 

Professional evaluations almost never happened and raises were hardly every given beyond a meager cost of living adjustment.

review_title: Very unorganized, no room to grow
pros: Work-life balance, not a lot of pressure from higher ups, break at Christmas time,
cons: leadership is nonexistent, raises are not possible, promotions not available, evaluations do not take place, toxic office environment, when new ideas are proposed they are immediately shut down. New employees feel empowered to make things better, only to be worn out and hardened into thinking nothing can be done to improve the place. Communication is terrible, within the office and inter office. Decisions are made without telling the admissions office/counselors, and then information is passed along incorrectly.

pros: People are nice and you get extra time off during the Christmas holidays

review_title: I had a wonderful time at LRC
pros: Great people, laid back, fun, nice new office area, clean, the facilities are new and the school is growing and growing
cons: There pay isn't the greatest. The athletic budget is one of the smallest in the NCAA division 3.  Parking can be an issue.

review_title: Adjunct Professor at La Roche College
pros: Great people to work with. International and diverse students. Strong curriculum and development team. Engaged students for the most part.
cons: Smaller school feel, limited campus and few full time positions available.
